result.execSummary:
The defendant David Scott Oesau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David Scott Oesau is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David Scott Oesau was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. Pay supervision fees. Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
* Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
* If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
* Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. 
May not have contact with Cornetta Stancil, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent. May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

1:45 PM Defendant David Scott Oesau in court, in custody. Attorney J. Eric Olson in court for David Scott Oesau.  Attorney Alexander Huber in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.   On state's motion, cts 2, 3, 4 are dismissed.  DE enters guilty plea to ct 1.  Court finds DE guilty of ct 1. PSI waived.  Court imposes and stays total sentence of 38 months WSP - 14 months IC and 24 months ES with conditions; DE placed on probation for 2 years with conditions; 122 days jail as a condition of probation with 122 days credit; costs ordered; DE not eligible for CIP or SAP;  DE to submit DNA sample and pay surcharge - notice given to DE in court. Appeal Rights, Federal Firearms Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Fr: DE re: request for faster court date
Letter from Def re: Motion to reopen. Cases are still in open status.

Defendant David Scott Oesau appeared with Attorney J. Eric Olson.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:09 - 02:13 PM    State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ AttorneyEric Olson. Clerk PU. Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 10:15 am. State objects to bond motion-Bond motion is denied. Bond Continues. ec
copy of bond motion sent to Atty Olson and DA.

Defendant David Scott Oesau in court, in custody.    Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Applicant is eligible for SPD Services

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  No drug paraphenalia  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Carmetta S, Mike S

02:27 PM    Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Benjamin Schwarz.   Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:45 am.. $150  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). rb
and witness list filed by the State
